San Juan Mountains Elopement Locations

These San Juan Mountains Elopement Locations are some of my favorite locations in Colorado! The San Juan Mountain Range is one of the most distinct and unique mountain ranges in Colorado. They stretch from southwest Colorado to northwest New Mexico. They‚Äôre known for their lush green and red mountainsides along with their gray rocky peaks ranging from dark gray to light gray. They have some of Colorado‚Äôs bluest lakes. And it‚Äôs known for some of the best off-roading trails in the state. Plus with towns like Ouray, Telluride, and Silverton you really can‚Äôt go wrong with choosing the San Juan Mountains as an elopement destination.

From easily accessible locations where you can just step out of your vehicle and be at the destination to epic hikes and backpacking spots. The San Juan mountains have everything you can possibly imagine for an adventurous elopement location. I‚Äôve written this list of over 30 locations as a guide for those thinking about eloping in Colorado‚Äôs Southwest region. You will find locations ranging from easily accessible with a 2WD vehicle and no hike all the way to harder-to-reach locations via either a 4√ó4 trail or a hike.

The Towns of the San Juan Mountains

Telluride

Telluride, Colorado is one of the most iconic towns in the state. It‚Äôs like it‚Äôs own little world. Its packed with epic adventures year round and surrounded by some of the most gorgeous terrain in the state, the San Juan Mountains. Telluride has world class skiing and riding (including heli drops into the backcountry) in the winter. Plus every outdoor enthusiasts dream list of summer adventures like hiking, backpacking, paddle boarding and 4x4ing in the most gorgeous mountain range in the state.

Ridgway

In my mind, Ridgway is the gateway to the San Juans. It‚Äôs not until you start getting closer to Ridgway do you begin to see the infamous 14er, Mt. Sneffels. It‚Äôs a tiny little town with a beautiful river and park area that runs right through the middle of it. It‚Äôs got great tubing in the summer time and a few good restaurants that are worth checking out.

Ouray

Ouray is known at the ‚ÄúSwitzerland of Colorado‚Äù and the second you pull into town you‚Äôll see why. It‚Äôs got that old wild west movie vibe. Ouray is a great central hub for local hikes and 4√ó4 trails. The town boasts a few cool restaurants and several hot springs lodges.

Silverton

Silverton feels like the SxS capital of the state. The land between Ouray and Silverton (and everywhere else around them) is covered in epic trails to ride. Silverton is another town straight out of a wild west movie. It‚Äôs doesn‚Äôt have any hotels but it does have an RV park and plenty of epic places to disperse camp. The hikes around Silverton are some of my favorite in the SJs.

Durango

Durango is South of Silverton on 550, just before you hit New Mexico. It‚Äôs an awesome and colorful little town with the Animas River running right through it. You can take the Silverton to Durango trail for a gorgeous ride through the San Juan Mountains. You‚Äôll pass through Chicago Basin, a popular backpacking area that is only accessible via the train. Durango is a little bigger of a town and offers more modern amenities like hotels, restaurants and big chain grocery stores. The San Juan River runs through town where you can find tubers, kayakers, and white water rafters.

Pagosa Springs

Pagosa Springs is just a little east of Durango. It‚Äôs famous for it‚Äôs geothermal hot springs and accompanying hot springs resort. It‚Äôs an often popular town for mountain goers because of it‚Äôs direct access into the San Juan Mountains.

Lake City

Lake City is a small little town on the east of the San Juan Mountains. It‚Äôs on the other side of California Pass from Silverton & Ouray. Here you‚Äôll find the trailhead for multiple 14ers including one of the easiest and most beautiful, Handies Peak.

Easily Accessible Elopement Locations in the San Juan Mountains | 2WD or AWD

San Sophia Overlook

Venue at the top of San Sophia Gondola near the top of Lift 7 at Telluride Ski Resort

Easily accessible walk to the location upon getting off the gondola

Available to be reserved starting at $5000 for weddings and $2000/hour for elopements or photos on the overlook

Booking info here

Nearest town: Telluride

Note- photos & elopements can be happen elsewhere near the overlook on National Forest lands with no reservation. Just not on the overlook itself without a reservation.

Million Dollar Highway

Highway 550 runs from Ouray to Silverton to Durango with million-dollar views of Aspen trees that turn beautiful gold & red colors in the fall

This highway has several locations that are easily accessible from it ‚Äì this photo only being one that is closest to Ouray.

Hire me as your elopement photographer to learn more!

Nearest towns: Silverton, Ouray, Durango & Ridgway

Last Dollar Road

In the Uncompahgre National Forest between Ridgway and Telluride, Colorado

18-mile unpaved road capable in most vehicles unless wet

Great spot for Fall elopements

has dispersed camp spots along it

4√ó4 vehicle with a lift is recommended to access most spots on the road- but if you‚Äôre brave and willing to send it I‚Äôve drive this road in my Chevy equinox before. üòâ

More info

Nearest towns: Ridgway & Telluride

Molas Lakes

In the San Juan National Forest near Silverton, Colorado

Just one mile off the Million Dollar Highway on an unpaved road

Views of the Weminuche Wilderness

Campsites are available for rent as well as a few dispersed, first come- first serve sites nearby

Nearest town: Silverton

Alta Lakes & Gold King Basin

In the Uncompahgre Forest near Telluride

Has dispersed campsites that are first come first serve

Can rent the Alta Lakes Observatory for a more luxurious elopement experience

Nearest town: Telluride

Trout Lake

15 miles from downtown Telluride on Highway 145

Can fish, kayak, and SUP on the lake

Swimming is allowed

Has reserved & first come first serve camping nearby at Matterhorn and Priest Lake campgrounds as well as dispersed camping in the area

Nearest town: Telluride

Top of the Pines

A wedding venue in Ridgway, Colorado that boasts vast open views of Mt. Sneffels and the surrounding mountains

If you have more than 20 guests this venue is perfect to rent for your wedding

More info

Nearest town: Ridgway, Ouray & Telluride

Amphitheater Campground

Located in Ouray, Colorado

Has reserved campsites and first come first serve

Gorgeous views, super close to town, and hiking & 4√ó4 trails

Reservation information

Nearest town: Ouray

Hiking Elopement Locations with Lakes & Waterfalls

Bear Creek Falls

5.1 mile out and back trail with just under 1100‚Ä≤ elevation gain (rated moderate but pretty easygoing)

monumental mountain views the entire way

trail winds through a beautiful tall Aspen tree forest

can be easily combined with Little Hawaii

Nearest town: Telluride

Little Hawaii

slot canyon-like formations with a creek and brightly colored rocks

a once-secret spot along Bear Creek Trail

best at sunrise before the crowds come

must stand in the creek

Nearest Town: Telluride

Bridal Veil Falls

2 mile out and back trail with 830‚Ä≤ elevation gain in Telluride

largest waterfall in Colorado

multiple waterfalls along the trail below Bridal Veil Falls

my favorite trail ever and just perfect in August!

Nearest Town: Telluride

Blue Lakes

Lower, Middle and Upper Blue Lakes in Telluride, Colorado

3.3 miles and ~1600 feet gain to the lower lake (pictured)

8.7 miles out and back to all three lakes with ~2500 feet gain

perfect location for a backpacking elopement with campsites at the lower lake in the trees and near the middle and upper lakes above tree line

Can access Mt Sneffels (14er) from here.

Nearest town: Ridgway & Telluride

Highland Mary & Verde Lakes Loop

8.1 mile loop trail with 2,234‚Ä≤ elevation gain

gorgeous views the entire way with multiple waterfalls

beautiful wildflowers in July and August

views of Electric and Vestal Peaks (prominent and distinct 13ers)

can be done as an out and back to just Highland Mary lake (pictured)

Nearest town: Silverton

Columbine Lake

8.3 mile out and back trail with 2,933‚Ä≤ elevation gain

above tree line, here you‚Äôll find the bluest lake in Colorado

perfect location for a backpacking elopement as the hike is strenuous

the trail winds through a gorgeous forest and then opens into a basin as you climb up and over a saddle before descending down to the lake

Nearest Town Silverton

Ice Lake & Island Lake

7.7 mile out and back with 2,680 feet gain

gorgeous views the entire way with multiple blue/teal lakes and an island

perfect for a backpacking elopement as you can camp at either lake

there is also first come first serve camping near the trailhead and just down the road

this is very close to South Fork Mineral Falls as a great side adventure

Nearest town: Silverton

South Fork Mineral Creek Falls

two-tiered waterfall surrounded by red rocks

easy 1-mile hike near Silverton, Colorado

creek crossing along the trail

perfect for a camping elopement

a great addition to a hiking elopement to Ice Lake or Island Lake

Nearest town: Silverton

Mystic Falls

less populated and gorgeous falls near Telluride, Colorado

4WD needed to access the trail

must follow written trail directions as there is no downloadable map

Elopement Locations with 4√ó4 Adventures

American Basin

a gorgeous basin filled with wildflowers in July

at the trailhead for Handies Peak (14er)

easy hike to Sloan Lake from the basin

Nearest town: Lake City

Yankee Boy Basin

near Ouray, Colorado

high clearance 4√ó4 vehicle needed

waterfalls, wildflowers & wildlife

Nearest town: Ouray

Governor‚Äôs Basin

near Ouray, Colorado

high clearance 4√ó4 vehicle needed

completely above tree line

waterfalls nearby

California Pass

chain of 4√ó4 roads connected Ouray to Silverton & Lake City

high clearance 4√ó4 vehicle needed

above tree line

can paddleboard, kayak or pack raft the lake (small hike in)

Bullion King Lake

4√ó4 road near Silverton, Colorado

high clearance 4√ó4 vehicle needed

can paddleboard or kayak

Clear Creek Lake

near Silverton, Colorado

4√ó4 road by the Ice and Island Lake trailhead

waterfalls nearby

Ohio Peak

4√ó4 trail to a short hike near Red Mountain Pass and Silverton, Colorado

Hiking Elopements Locations with Mountain Peaks & 14ers in the San Juan Mountains

Handies Peak (14er)

Trailhead is in American Basin

One of the easiest and most gorgeous 14ers in the state (Mt Sneffels is #1)

You pass Sloan Lake on the way to the Handies Peak

Mount Sneffels (14er)

A peak between Ouray, Ridgway & Telluride

Accessible from Blue Lakes Trailhead or Yankee Boy Basin (4WD high clearance needed to go to the upper trailhead)

Can be coupled with backpacking to Blue Lakes, Camping, or an evening in Ouray at the Hot Springs.

One of my bucketlist 14ers. The views looks top notch.

Uncompahgre Peak (14er)

A peak near Lake City

You turn off the road that goes to American Basin to drive up Nellie Creek
